required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Validation Study for Polyp Detection
clinical_study.official_title: Artificial Intelligence Validation Trial for Polyp Detection: Pilot Study

collaborator.agency: Nuovo Regina Margherita Hospital, Rome, Italy

brief_summary.textblock: Interventional prospective multicenter study: Polyp detection by an automated endoscopic tool as second observer during routine diagnostic colonoscopy

detailed_description.textblock: This is an investigator-initiated multicentre non-randomized prospective interventional trial to validate the performance of a novel state-of-the-art computer-aided diagnostic (CAD) tool in polyp detection implemented as second observer during routine diagnostic colonoscopy and to evaluate its feasibility in daily endoscopy. Patients referred for a screening surveillance or therapeutic colonoscopy will undergo a colonoscopy performed by an endoscopist with moderate to high adenoma detection rate (ADR > 20% and < 50%) while a second observer will follow the procedure on a bedside AI-tool to count the number of detections made by the AI system and categorize the results into positive or negative results as follows (1) true positive, (2) false negative, (3) other positive and (4) obvious false positive. When a doubtful detection is made by the AI-system, the second observer will ask to re-evaluate the indicated region. When the detection is clear, the endoscopist and second observer do not communicate. The entire procedure is recorded.

primary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic accuracy of the novel AI system compared to endoscopic diagnosis as gold standard
primary_outcome.description: Determination of the diagnostic accuracy of the novel AI system as second observer

secondary_outcome.measure: Endoscopist's polyp miss rate as number of extra AI detections
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of the AI system's precision and extra value as second observer

intervention.description: Colonoscopy enriched with artificial intelligence tool developed for polyp detection, implemented as a second observer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- > 18 years
- Diagnostic or screening colonoscopy
- Therapeutic colonoscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to give informed consent by the patient or legal representative
- < 18 years old
- Any contraindication for colonoscopy or biopsies of the colon
- Uncontrolled coagulopathy
- Confirmed diagnosis of inflammatory bowel disease
- Short bowel or ileostomy
- Pregnancy

patient_data.ipd_description: We don't share any patient information with other researchers, nor when it's anonymized

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
